bill_title: to revise certain provisions authorizing health insurance coverage by municipalities, counties, and school districts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal certain provisions authorizing health insurance coverage by municipalities, counties, and school districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 3-12A-2.1 be repealed. 3-12A-2.1. Any municipality, county or school district may obtain and pay for all forms of health insurance, a dental insurance plan, or both, or in lieu thereof, make other arrangements, including entering into agreements with others, which agreements may create separate legal or administrative entities pursuant to chapter 1-24. Section 2. That § 3-12A-2.2 be repealed. 3-12A-2.2. Any municipality, county or school district may provide for health insurance for retiring employees and their spouses and dependents as the governing body may deem appropriate. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions authorizing health insurance coverage by municipalities, counties, and school districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 3-12A-2.1 be repealed. 3-12A-2.1. Any municipality, county or school district may obtain and pay for all forms of health insurance, a dental insurance plan, or both, or in lieu thereof, make other arrangements, including entering into agreements with others, which agreements may create separate legal or administrative entities pursuant to chapter 1-24. Section 2. That § 3-12A-2.2 be repealed. 3-12A-2.2. Any municipality, county or school district may provide for health insurance for retiring employees and their spouses and dependents as the governing body may deem appropriate. Section 3. That chapter 6-1 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any municipality, county, or school district may obtain and pay for all forms of health insurance, a dental insurance plan, or both, or in lieu thereof, make other arrangements, including entering into agreements with others, which agreements may create separate legal or administrative entities pursuant to chapter 1-24. Section 4. That chapter 6-1 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any municipality, county, or school district may provide for health insurance for retiring employees and their spouses and dependents as the governing body may deem appropriate. BILL HISTORY January 14 - First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 25 January 17 - Scheduled for hearing. January 17 - Passed as amended, PASSED, AYES 12, NAYS 1. H.J. 62 January 17 - Amended title. H.J. 63
